channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: US allies band together against China
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping surprised the world with a speech at Davos in 2017, defending free trade and joint action on climate change as then US president-elect Donald Trump argued for precisely the opposite. It might have been an overambitious pitch by Xi to position China as the world's next leader, but it also seemed a genuine sign that Beijing was committing to the international rules-based order.

item.title: Trump punishes China for actions in Hong Kong
item.description: President Donald Trump plans to address China during afternoon remarks at the White House, officials said.

item.title: Trump offers denial and delusion as pandemic crisis overtakes his presidency
UK will pay a hefty price for kicking out Huawei
The US reports more than 67,000 new cases, highest daily jump so far
Early trials for coronavirus vaccine show 'promising' results
item.description: A Covid-19 vaccine developed by the biotechnology company Moderna in partnership with the National Institutes of Health has been found to induce immune responses in all of the volunteers who received it in a Phase 1 study.

item.title: 'Just ludicrous.' Anderson Cooper slams Trump's Covid-19 comments
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper says that President Donald Trump turned a Rose Garden event into a campaign rally and again ignored the coronavirus pandemic while citing a lie about Covid-19 testing.

item.title: New York Times moves some staff out of Hong Kong as security law brings media chill
item.description: The New York Times is moving some staff out of Hong Kong due to a new security law imposed by China on the city, as both foreign and local media face increased uncertainty in the Asian financial hub.

item.title: Bus driver deliberately crashes killing 21 people
item.description: Local Police say a driver deliberately crashed a bus full of passengers into a reservoir in southwestern China, hours after discovering his house had been demolished.

item.title: 'Glee' star Naya Rivera died from drowning, autopsy rules
item.description: An autopsy issued by the Ventura County Medical Examiner's Office has ruled that actress Naya Rivera died as a result of drowning.

item.title: China reels as 'grim' flooding disaster threatens coronavirus recovery
item.description: Weeks of torrential rains have caused the worst flooding in China in recent decades, destroying the homes and livelihoods of millions of people as the country struggles to revive an economy battered by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Ivanka Trump campaign tells out-of-work Americans to 'find something new'
item.description: Four months before the presidential election, Ivanka Trump, adviser to her father President Donald Trump, is promoting a new ad campaign dubbed, "Find Something New."

item.title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg hospitalized for possible infection
item.description: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg has been taken to the hospital and treated for a possible infection, according to a court spokeswoman.

item.title: Jeff Sessions loses Alabama GOP Senate runoff to Trump-backed Tuberville
item.description: Jeff Sessions lost an Alabama Senate GOP primary runoff on Tuesday to former Auburn University football coach Tommy Tuberville, CNN projects, a major blow to the former attorney general who faced fierce opposition to his candidacy from President Donald Trump.

item.title: Fauci spat illustrates what some fear is a directionless White House
Coronavirus cases soar by more than 1 million over 5 days
Boy fatally shot while picking up phone charger
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon talks to the grandfather of an 11-year-old boy who was fatally shot.

item.title: Doctors remove a worm that was living in woman's tonsil
item.description: A woman in Japan got more than she bargained for after visiting the doctor with an irritated throat, as she was told that a worm was living inside her tonsil.

item.title: Cuomo: My 10-year-old knows better than what Trump just said
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo analyzes President Trump's "up-is-down strategy" when fighting the Covid-19 pandemic, and defends Dr. Anthony Fauci from the Trump administration's attacks.

item.title: Tyra Banks is the new host of 'Dancing with the Stars'
item.description: Businesswoman and supermodel Tyra Banks can now add host of "Dancing with the Stars" to her portfolio.

item.title: Trump admin. scraps policy that would have seen foreign students deported
Lindsey Graham breaks with Trump in Fauci feud
item.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) spoke out in support of Dr. Fauci after President Trump publicly criticized the immunologist and an unnamed White House official tried to discredit him.

item.title: New Mexico DA sues 'vigilante' militia group with alleged ties to white supremacy
item.description: In the wake of a protest that turned violent after a man opened fire on demonstrators last month, a prosecutor in New Mexico is taking legal action against a militia group they claim poses a continuing threat to public safety.

item.title: Nissan unveils its first electric SUV, the Ariya
item.description: The Nissan Ariya, the company's first all-electric SUV, will be able to drive up to 300 miles on a single charge and features a high-tech interior, with almost no buttons or knobs, according to the automaker.

item.title: Airline matriarch given suspended jail sentence for abusing domestic staff
item.description: The matriarch of the Korean Air dynasty has been given a suspended jail sentence for assaulting her domestic staff, including physically hurting her chauffeur and throwing metal shears at her gardener.

item.title: See what Trump supporters are saying as pandemic worsens
item.description: CNN's Ed Lavandera speaks to voters in the traditionally conservative city of McKinney, Texas, where political analysts say President Donald Trump is vulnerable in the upcoming 2020 presidential election.

item.title: American woman caught in romance scam freed after being held by lover for more than a year
item.description: A man has been arrested for allegedly luring an American woman to Nigeria and defrauding her of $48,000, police told CNN on Tuesday.

item.title: US carries out first federal execution in 17 years
item.description: Daniel Lewis Lee, a convicted killer, was executed Tuesday morning. It was the first federal execution in 17 years after the Supreme Court issued an overnight ruling that it could proceed.

item.title: Environmentalist sneaks past guards and makes shocking find
item.description: Russian authorities claim to have contained the massive spill in Norilsk, but a whistleblower and an environmentalist tell CNN the damage is much worse than disclosed and poses a threat to the ecosystem of the Arctic Ocean. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen reports.

item.title: The Maldives is now open to all global tourists. Here's how they're doing it
item.description: Though border restrictions and quarantine measures are keeping people from visiting many of the world's most popular travel destinations at the moment, one country famed for its natural beauty is now welcoming all guests -- the Maldives.

item.title: Trump repeatedly calls famous football coach by wrong name
item.description: President Donald Trump repeatedly referred to the University of Alabama's head football coach Nick Saban by the wrong name during a call on the eve of the state's Republican runoff race.

item.title: Apple customers can now submit claims as part of settlement over slowing down iPhones
item.description: Apple customers who purchased certain previous iPhone models can now submit claims for about $25 per phone as part of the company's settlement of a class action lawsuit that accused it of slowing down older devices.

item.title: From cheese-rolling to grime: The curious pastimes of the English
item.description: In an old English tradition, believed by some to have pagan origins, the people of Brockworth, Gloucestershire, chase a wheel of cheese down a steep hill on the last Monday of every May. The cheese is taken home by whoever tumbles to the bottom first.

item.title: 'Dirty Dancing' lake is filling up with water 12 years after it dried up
item.description: In 2008, Mountain Lake, made famous by the 1987 film "Dirty Dancing," dried up and remained that way for over a decade. But this summer, it's starting to fill back up, astonishing both locals and visitors.

item.title: Police video captures dramatic rescue of baby girl
item.description: Dashcam video captured a Michigan police officer's dramatic rescue of a 3-week-old girl.

item.title: Viola Davis stars on a history-making new magazine cover
item.description: Vanity Fair's latest edition is fronted by Oscar-winning actor Viola Davis as photographed by Dario Calmese. It's the first time a Black photographer has shot the cover.

item.title: Engineers have created a new kind of brick
item.description: Although we're surrounded by millions of them every day, most of us don't think about bricks too often. For thousands of years, the humble clay-fired brick hasn't changed. The building blocks of modern suburban homes would be familiar to the city planners of ancient Babylon, the bricklayers of the Great Wall of China, or the builders of Moscow's Saint Basil's Cathedral.

item.title: Radio host loses show after harassing Spanish-speaking workers
item.description: Dianna Ploss, who had a show on WSMN in New Hampshire, livestreamed the racist incident on Facebook.

item.title: World's population likely to shrink after 50 years
item.description: The world's population is likely to peak at 9.7 billion in 2064, and then decline to about 8.8 billion by the end of the century, as women get better access to education and contraception, a new study has found.

item.title: Unusual supernova sent this star speeding across our galaxy
item.description: A white dwarf star has been sent zooming across our Milky Way galaxy thanks to the blast from a unique kind of supernova that it managed to survive, according to a new study.

item.title: One man holds multiple trademarks on potential Washington Redskins replacement names
item.description: The Washington NFL franchise announced on Monday that it would be changing its team name, but one man has already beaten them to the punch by trademarking a number of potential options.

item.title: Nursing home recreates famous album covers using its residents as models
item.description: The residents of one nursing home in England have turned into album cover stars.

item.title: UK will pay hefty price for kicking out Huawei
item.description: • How much trouble is Huawei in? • Here's why 5G is the future

item.title: He has over 6M TikTok followers. Here's why he is concerned
item.description: TikTok, the popular Chinese app that struck a chord with Gen Z, has found itself navigating tricky political territories. Following India's ban, now the US is also looking to block TikTok citing security concerns. CNN's Hadas Gold reports on the pressure TikTok and its community face.

item.title: China sanctions Lockheed Martin for Taiwan arms sales
item.description: China said on Tuesday it would place sanctions on Lockheed Martin for its involvement in arms sales to Taiwan, a move that could further escalate tensions between Beijing and Washington.

item.title: US declares most of Beijing's South China Sea claims illegal
item.description: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Monday announced a formal rejection of "most" of China's maritime claims in the South China Sea, the latest in the escalation between Washington and Beijing.

item.title: Trump offers denial and delusion as pandemic crisis overtakes his presidency
item.description: • Vaccine shows 'promising' results • LIVE: CDC director offers bleak outlook • Analysis: You won't believe what Trump just said about testing • This city is now US epicenter, expert says

item.title: 4 takeaways from primary elections and runoffs in Texas, Alabama and Maine
item.description: President Donald Trump will be able to claim victory after a pair of down-ballot contests Tuesday evening where two high-profile Republican candidates he supported prevailed in primary races.

item.title: Trump leans into racist rhetoric, downplays police violence against Black Americans
item.description: President Donald Trump repeated racist talking points in downplaying police violence against Black Americans during a CBS News interview on Tuesday, claiming that "more White people" are dying at the hands of law enforcement than Black people.
